meanings.definition: To make something resemble or conform to the principles or practices of Nazism.
meanings.sent1: The group tried to nazify their uniforms by adding swastikas.
meanings.sent2: The propaganda was used to nazify the population and spread hate.
meanings.sent3: The school play about Nazis accidentally ended up trying to nazify the audience.
meanings.sent4: The new leader's speeches aimed to nazify the minds of the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibit was a chilling attempt to nazify creativity.

meanings.definition: To subject to the influence or control of Nazism.
meanings.sent1: The invading army sought to nazify the occupied territories.
meanings.sent2: The regime's goal was to nazify every aspect of daily life.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer jokingly said he would nazify the runway with swastika patterns.
meanings.sent4: The cult leader's charisma was so strong, he could nazify the minds of his followers.
meanings.sent5: The extremist group's propaganda aimed to nazify vulnerable individuals.
